segments.text: Looking at the woman, I can’t help but wonder how she stays so focused.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way she polishes that plate seems almost meditative, yet so misplaced in this moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about the water flooding the countertop, a sign of neglect that she doesn’t acknowledge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: While she dries dishes, chaos brews right behind her, and it feels unfair, somehow.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s as if she’s in a different world, detached from the impending mishaps.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the boy’s determination as he reaches for the cookies, a mixture of bravery and folly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout a warning, but it seems futile; she wouldn’t hear me over the running water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s eagerness pulls at my heartstrings; she just wants a piece of the thrill.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet all this joy is tinged with the realization that someone is bound to get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I look outside at the garden, wishing for that peace to seep into this chaotic scene.
segments.speaker: PAR
